meaning: Erroneous in date; containing an anachronism; in a wrong time.
(of a person) Having an opinion of the past; preferring things or values of the past; behind the times; over-conservative.
sentences: It's finished, " he exclaims before embarking on a lengthy rant about how anachronistic the medium seems in the digital age.
It 's finished,  he exclaims before embarking on a lengthy rant about how anachronistic the medium seems in the digital age.
Edmond is unconvincing as a character, a bizarrely anachronistic Brideshead type who could only exist in dreamy romantic reveries of the female mind.

But such schemes were now obsolete an& anachronistic. They led to a languid lingering Italian campaign, which was settled far beyond the Alps by Philips victories over the French at St Quentin and Gravelines.
